meanings.definition: A person who toggles between different options or settings.
meanings.sent1: The togglers in the office always know how to switch between tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent2: I need to find a togglers to help me navigate through all these different projects.
meanings.sent3: The togglers at the party kept changing their minds about which game to play.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to be a togglers in both work and personal life is truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The togglers in the group discussion effortlessly shifted between various topics.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to fasten or secure objects by toggling.
meanings.sent1: The new togglers on my jacket makes it so much easier to put on.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a spare togglers in my toolbox for quick repairs.
meanings.sent3: The togglers on the gate clicked shut with a satisfying sound.
meanings.sent4: The old suitcase had a broken togglers, making it difficult to close.
meanings.sent5: The togglers on the backpack securely held all my belongings in place.

meanings.definition: The act of switching back and forth between different options or settings.
meanings.sent1: His constant togglers between TV channels was giving me a headache.
meanings.sent2: The togglers between light and dark mode on the phone is so convenient.
meanings.sent3: The meeting turned into a togglers of opinions on the best course of action.
meanings.sent4: The togglers between work tasks and personal errands kept her busy all day.
meanings.sent5: The constant togglers of weather made it hard to decide what to wear.
